courses.name: C
courses.desc: We start from scratch and end up creating more complex programs with threads or a graphical interface.

courses.name: Java
courses.desc: The course is explaining a lot of concepts up to Java16, including graphical libraries like SWING, AWT, or JavaFX.

courses.name: OCaml
courses.desc: This is a course for beginners in OCaml or in functional languages.

courses.name: HTML
courses.desc: A big summary of what you need to know in HTML to make a website.

courses.name: CSS
courses.desc: What's CSS and how you could use it to make your website looks better.

courses.name: JavaScript
courses.desc: A short introduction to JavaScript used to make interactive websites or required for Node.js/Typescript courses.

courses.name: PHP
courses.desc: Almost everything you will use in PHP to make your website server-side in PHP.

courses.name: NoSQL
courses.desc: Learn about NoSQL with MongoDB and Cypher.

courses.name: Assembly
courses.desc: A short introduction to ARM assembly.

courses.name: Cyber security
courses.desc: Everything related to the security of your accounts, applications, websites should be kept here.

courses.name: Node.js
courses.desc: Learn how you could use node to handle server-side logic, creating an API, or even creating an application with electron.

courses.name: Typescript
courses.desc: Write once and compile in any version of Javascript.

courses.name: API
courses.desc: An application programming interface (API) is an interface allowing a user to use someone else services without digging into the code.
